reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good as a portable backup, but can't beat a system with a subwoofer
reviews.author: DJ_Level_3
reviews.content: I'll preface this by saying that this is a great speaker and I recommend it as a portable speaker for when you can't use a proper subwoofer.However, it is no replacement for a proper subwoofer, as without using copious bass boost on my phone, the subs in the songs I listen to are very quiet, especially on lower volume (such as indoor listening). With some bass boost and some volume, however, it does sound good with the low subs in songs like Escape by Noisestorm.It also gets very loud for its size, and the sound is good without excessive mids or highs. It is truly in stereo as well, which is nice. Overall, I'd give this an 9/10 as a portable backup to my home and car stereos, and a 7/10 as a general speaker.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2024

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sounds great! Connectivity tho...
reviews.author: Ambrosia
reviews.content: -The speaker sounds great, good volume, good range, I'm really pleased that I found a nice little speaker box to play for my little Visio flatscreen from 2010 that pumps out loud clear sound, treble and bass.-Battery life is short imo, BUT, I'd be happy to just leave it plugged in, as it's substituting for the speakers on an old tv. I'd be a lot happier if the charging cord was longer, I'd like 3 feet. Normally I'd have spares but this speaker has a type I don't have many interchangeable spares for. So this speaker is on a short leash.-But finally, and here's my sticking point: the bluetooth doesn't stay connected right. Several times since I got this last September have I had to make my laptop forget the speaker and reconnect it, to get it to work. I have the booklet, it's clear, it's fine, what's not fine is having to redo all this stuff again every now and then.Not sure I'll buy Tribit again to replace my other speaker box that's starting to get raspy on me. Might take a risk on a different brand.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2024

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars good for inside the house or in your backyard
reviews.author: Lance F.
reviews.content: recieved it today and tested it out, I think it's pretty good for the price. the connectivity was fast and it's easy to set up all you have to do is turn it on and turn on the Bluetooth and you're set.slightly heavy not something I would want to be holding onto my pants or etc. was testing out the sound from outdoors and indoors and it'd be good for a house party. if you want to use it for renting out a big space like a hall for a babyshower or wedding etc. it might not be the best thing to bring and depend on for music
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really love this speaker!
reviews.author: Vottofan
reviews.content: Music generally sounds pretty good on an iPod or iPad--as long as you're listening through earbuds. Just playing it from the speakers is generally not a great musical experience. Knowing I would be spending a lot of time in my kitchen while baking goodies for Christmas, I decided to check out Amazon to see if I could find a small speaker to use with my iPod. I looked at two speakers--this one, and the OontZ Angle 3 Bluetooth Speaker. Both get high ratings, both had similar prices (on sale at the time) and I liked that the OontZ came in various colors. I spent several hours going back and forth, looking at features, reading a lot of reviews, and checking out the User Manuals for each that Amazon had posted. One thing I noticed was that the OontZ manual was significantly more detailed than the Tribit, and, not being very technologically savvy, that swayed me at first toward the OontZ. Before placing my order though, I went to the internet the next morning and typed in "comparison of OontZ Angle 3 and Tribit Bluetooth Speakers." One review I found helped me finally decide which speaker to order. Someone gave his opinion about each, then actually played snippets of the same song on each of the speakers, demonstrating the sound on 3 (if I remember correctly) different sound levels. Though both speakers sounded pretty good, I could tell a slight difference between the Tribit and OontZ; the sound on the Tribit was a little fuller, with slightly more bass. I placed my order and received it later that same day. I had no problem linking the Tribit to my iPod via Bluetooth (the iPod recognized it immediately) and was soon listening to Christmas music as I baked cookies that evening. The only thing that would have made it better would be if it had come with a 3.5 mm AUX Cable so I could connect my iPod directly to the speaker, but I don't know that any speakers include that. Not a big deal...I can always see if Amazon has one and if not, I can still connect via Bluetooth. I didn't rate battery life because I don't know for sure how long it is before the battery has to be charged. The speaker worked out of the box, but I didn't know if it was fully or partially charged, so after using it that first evening for several hours, I plugged it in to charge. I've had it a week now; have used it 3-4 hours for several days during the week and haven't had to charge it again yet, so my guess is that battery life is pretty good. Overall, I'm very pleased with the Tribit and would heartily recommend it.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024

reviews.content: I was unfamiliar with this brand but decided to take a risk on this. I purchased this speaker so I could listen to music while I worked in my garden and in my greenhouse. Well let me outline the Pros and Cons of this speaker for you if you are looking for the perfect speaker!CONS- None!PROS- Awesome sound, Great Bass, no distortion when I turned up the volume. The sound worked well outside even at a significant distance. I have not even maxed out the volume except to test it. I usually find myself turning it down. The battery is amazing. I have been using it for several hours each day for a couple of weeks and I‚Äôve only charged it twice. üëÄ I find this amazing considering the amount of use it gets. I wondered how this would sound because I love crisp clean sounds and some speakers just don‚Äôt cut it. But this speaker was amazing and has made me a believer! I‚Äôve even used it for phone calls. The sound wasn‚Äôt as crisp and clear during a call outside as my music was. But it was still a clear sounding call. I would buy this again!

My wife was amazed at the big sound coming from such a small speaker. It's six inches long, two inches wide and 2 inches high. It actually fits in my front pocket. But, but the sound is BIG. Easily sounds good in a good sized room. It's inexpensive a very portable. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tribit X-sound Go-Speaker
reviews.author: Hank
reviews.content: The sound is phenomenal. However, after charging the battery for six hours, the speaker shut down and required re-charge after only about two hours of play time. The instruction booklet that comes with the speaker is all but worthless. The booklet dimensions are about 2" by 2" with a thickness of about 3/16 of an inch - and most of it is written in a foreign language. There are no instructions about charging. NOTE - I did NOT use my computer to charge the speaker. I used a standard 5W brick that is also used for smart phones.Update to last eval: Follow-up to my last review. The manufacturer has offered me a complete refund for the Tribit speaker I purchased. But, I am going to hold on to my speaker, for now, and will go through another charge/recharge episode to see if I can improve on the results. I am very grateful to the manufacturer for their kind offer and their customer service.Update 3 May: I re-evaluate this product to 5 stars. I am convinced my original eval was based on a failure on my part. My Tribit speaker seems to be holding a charge as it should.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 20, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars This speaker rocks, here's why....
reviews.author: The Spicy Texan
reviews.content: Tribit XSound Go Bluetooth Speaker is just the bomb. Even when blasting up the volume to full high there was no distortion. Tribit has excellent well rounded sound, amazing base and surprisingly pleasing clarity. I use Android, and I can even adjust the volume of the speaker on the phone or you can use them together for the ultimate portable speaker experience. Though small it is substantial, almost a pound in weight, and a fit-in-your-hand size. The sound outdoors covers my entire corner-lot huge backyard. The controls on the top are simple, raised rubber, easily pressed, and there are simply only 5 buttons. There are on/off and pairing tones. There is a DC and Aux plug with a rubber cover in the charger plate on the back. It has 4 little tiny rubber feet that will hold it in place even on a flat surface with an incline. If you would like, you could place a piece of velcro on the bottom. Pairing takes just a few seconds, and it paired immediately upon charging the first time. You can answer calls while the speaker is playing by pressing play, and there is a built in microphone that others tell me sounds great when I call them. The Tribit doubles as a speakerphone. How great is that?I easily charge it up in my car usb or with my computer, with the right cables, other charging options would be available. I've played sleep sounds all night long, and it stays charged! You can also keep it plugged in too while using. 24 hours of use is possible before this gem of a speaker needs a charge! It has a red light indicator when it is charging, when it is finished, the light goes off. The charging cord seems less than 2 feet so you may want to get a longer one, but I've not needed one at all. I think with a specific cable it could be connected to a non-bluetooth TV, PC. Connects to Alexa with the word Trib-bit. I have used it and paired it easily with Google Home Mini. I love that it is waterproof! Poolside, hottub, shower or beach...no worries.If you love listening to podcasts, or talk radio, this is the speaker you want! Voice clarity on this is stunning, and I can hear it throughout my house if I have to walk away for a moment! As long as you have the speaker paired, you should expect that it would work with any app that has sound on your phone.There is a wrist strap connected to one end of the speaker for carrying, hanging. I purchased the gray Aenllosi Hard Shell Case light weight case to go with my black Tribit.When the battery is low, it announces in a realistic male voice that "Battery is Low"When it is charging at the same time as on, the indicator light is a combination of red and blue, so you can easily know it is plugged in and on. When it is fully charged, the charge indicator light turns off.I hope that this review helps someone on the fence to just get this jewel of a speaker!UPDATE 5/17/24: I have two of these speakers I got in 2020. One quit charging a year ago, nevermind I've used that particular speaker only a couple of dozen times. In looking at the questions on this product, I see many people have their speakers quit charging, MANY. That is disappointing. I will attempt to reach the company but despite the hours I put this speaker on the charger, it still blinks red and shows only 30% charged. I will attempt to contact the manufacturer and come back with their solution. Their solution was simple. Turn on the unit, press the + and - signs simultaneously and this resets the unit. It worked and started charging. Hopefully this helps others.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2019

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Small but Loud

reviews.content: We decided to get a new, state-of-art portable speaker for our outdoor patio. We were interested in its portability and bluetooth connectivity, in addition to decent sound quality. After some research we ended up with small Tribit because it's very affordable price but because other people had commented positively on its capabilities. We definitely like and enjoy our new Tribit in our outdoor garden-battery life is good as we have played it non-stop outdoors for a 5 hour stretch. The sound quality is very good even with some bass notes. We plan to take the Tribit on our vacations and to our second home in Latin America. This is a good, affordable buy over some of the really expensive offerings.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2024

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly great!
reviews.author: Fantom.XR7
reviews.content: I was not expecting much when I purchased this but it has been great! I use it mainly when I shower (lol) so it's gotten wet and it's fallen a couple of times but it's held up pretty well.The sound quality is decent, the battery lasts a long time, and the bass is punchy.My only gripe is that it's rounded so I can't set it up vertically and when it's on a smooth suface since it vibrates cause of the sound it will move and fall off where placed. The feet at the bottom that are supposed to prevent that don't do a very good job of keeping it stable. Other than that it's great.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2024

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great sound quality, poor Bluetooth range

reviews.content: Nearly everything about it is great except for it's range. As soon as I put my phone on my pocket, the sound starts cutting out
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not very durable.
reviews.author: Joyce
reviews.content: When new, the sound quality is pretty good. It's easy to connect to a bluetooth device and consumer friendly. The drawback is that you can only expect this speaker to last 2 years or so before the bluetooth begins to malfunction or quit working entirely. Two speakers in slightly over 3 years have proven to me that Tribit isn't the way to go.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars OLD DOG LEARNS NEW TRICK!
reviews.author: Dick S.
reviews.content: Being a senior, I don't easily relate to any product that has words like "Bluetooth" prominently displayed in the instructions. Admittedly, it took me much longer than the average seven-year-old to figure this thing out. But once I did, Kate bar the door! Absolutely terrific sound and its' ease of use even has an old dog like me, acting like I know what I'm doing. Great charging life, common-sense controls, and totally portable. Only wish I had bought one years ago!
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product for a great price
reviews.author: Peter B Schuyler
reviews.content: In my household we have:Anker original Soundcore , 7 yrs old. Battery has weakened but still an amazing little speaker.Doss original Soundbox Touch, 5 yrs old. Also a good speaker similar to the Anker.A pair of Doss Soundbox XL speakers. For the price these speakers can‚Äôt be beat when looking for a non portable Bluetooth speaker. They can be moved but I don't think of them as portable speakers.JBL Flip4. Indestructible and great sound.Why did I buy the Tribit XSound Go? My top criteria when looking for a new speaker was that it would slide in and out of a pants pocket or pouch pocket of a sweatshirt easily. The shape, size and weight of the Tribit XSound Go is perfect for that. The Tribit's loudness is equal to the JBL Flip4 but I would say the sound quality of the JBL Flip4 is slightly better however, I wouldn't argue with people who prefer the sound of the Tribit. Lastly, the build quality of the Tribit is very good.For a price of around $35 the Tribit XSound Go is a fantastic speaker.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2024

content.product_name: Tribit Bluetooth Speaker, XSound Go Speaker with 16W Loud Sound & Deeper Bass, 24H Playtime, IPX7 Waterproof, Bluetooth 5.0 TWS Pairing Portable Wireless Speaker for Home, Outdoor (Upgraded)

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great powerful litttle speaker with decent battery life
reviews.author: Jazzsticks
reviews.content: If you are looking for a good value speaker I would reccomend this unit. It can get quite loud and the bass very punchy however do not forget to charge it. The battery depletes somewhat faster than I'd like and I'm met with a "battery low" strange voice over 5 minutes or so before the unit power down. I would appreciate a light bar or warning that gives me a solid 15 minutes of listening before I have to recharge it. Battery aside this speaker does more than enough for casual to intense listening and using it in the bathroom during showers is primarily what I do with it. It meets my needs. I sometimes take it out on the basketball field and I can hear it in the distance properly. I know they make better sounding speakers but Tribit did not let me down and I found good value in this speaker for the most part.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Meh, seems as advertised but some initial quality issues
reviews.author: Tom H.
reviews.content: Too early to tell how finicky this speaker might be, so I will update review as needed. Sound is good enough, but I had no high bars in this price range anyway. Bass is weak (as expected), but midrange and highs sound a little crisper than my Maxsound Plus unit purchased a little over a year ago. The case, which is a textured soft plastic material, seemed smudgy and the USB-C connector was a little loose - making it seem like this was a slightly used unit re-packaged as new. Bummer if true.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super tough, reliable and portable speaker with AWESOME sound quality that is AFORDABLE! LOVE IT! üòç
reviews.author: QueenB
reviews.content: I bought this speaker to go with our Echo Dot because I had heard that the Dot speaker is nice, but not great. I couldn't be happier with that decision! The speaker on the Dot is ok, but it's not good enough to use when we have people over, while we're outside playing, or while we're swimming. This little speaker is AMAZING!!! It charges quickly, the charge lasts through all day use and it is LOUD! And loud in a good way! We listen to all types of music - rock, rap, r&b, country, pretty much anything - and the sound quality is spot on, no matter what type of music we're listening to! The other day I connected the speaker to my phone and played some music from the Amazon music app while we were in the pool. I left my phone on the porch, about 50-55 feet away, so it wouldn't get wet and had the speaker on a table right next to the pool. It never lost the signal from my phone and at about a little over half the volume it was loud enough to be heard over the kids (and I have a 3 year old and an 11 year old that don't believe in talking, they prefer yelling), the pool filter running and an attachment we have for the pool that turns the clean water from the filter into a fountain that gets pretty noisy. We were in the pool for about 2 hours and the speaker got pretty wet from all the splashing (though it never got totally soaked or submerged) and it's still working like it was brand new. What I was most concerned about was it's ability to survive being dropped or whacked against something pretty hard because my 3 year old can be brutal to toys, or pretty much anything she gets her hands on! So far, it's been dropped at least 3 times, knocked into the wall twice while she was holding it and dancing/spinning and sat on about 5 times because she always ends up leaving it on the couch or chair (both of which are dark brown) instead of a table and sure enough someone (including my 140lb self) ends up plopping down on it. No damage to the speaker AT ALL!!! For spending just under $30 I feel like we got more than our money's worth! If I do one day have an issue with the speaker, I'm fairly confident this seller's customer service would be more than helpful with resolving any problems. I say this because they reached out to me after I bought the speaker to thank me for my purchase and to provide their contact information should I have any questions, concerns, or issues. About a week after I received the speaker they touched base with me once more to thank me again for the purchase, to say they hoped that I was happy with the product and to let me know that they were always available to help in any way possible. Now I know that actions speak louder than words, but since I have been more than happy with this speaker I have had no reason to put their "always here to help" claim to the test. If I should ever have to contact customer service in the future, I will update my review. I apologize for the length of my review, but I'm just so happy with this little speaker! I usually don't leave reviews because most of what I purchase on Amazon turns out to be just what I expected, no more and no less. But I've been so impressed by this Tribit speaker that I felt I had to share my experience. I hope this is helpful to anyone trying to decide if they should click that purchase button on this item. If you do, I sincerely believe that you will not be disappointed!!! üòÑ
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2018
